name: Venafi
description: This app integrates with an instance of Venafi to perform generic and investigative actions
latest_tested_version: Trust Protection Platform version 21.1, Tested on 3rd Aug 2021

username.description: Venafi API Username to authenticate with

password.description: Venafi API Password to authenticate with

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Returns a list of all policies in Venafi

actions.verbose: Either Subject or ObjectName parameter must be filled out.

policy_dn.description: The folder DN for the new certificate

subject.description: The Common Name (CN) field for the certificate. Either the subject or object_name parameter must be filled in

object_name.description: The Common Name (CN) field for the certificate. Either the subject or object_name parameter must be filled in

approvers.description: An array of one or more identities for certificate workflow approvers

cadn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the Trust Protection Platform Certificate Authority Template object

ca_specific_attributes.description: An array of name/value pairs providing any CA attributes to be stored with the Certificate object and submitted to the CA during enrollment

contacts.description: An array of one or more identities for users or groups who receive notifications about events pertaining to the object

country.description: The Country field for the certificate Subject DN

created_by.description: The setting to identify the object that initiated enrollment or provisioning changes

devices.description: An array of devices that require enrollment or provisioning

disable_automatic_renewal.description: The setting to control whether manual intervention is required for certificate renewal

elliptical_curve.description: P256, P384, or P521 encryption for Elliptical Curve Cryptography

key_algorithm.description: Algorithm for public key of Certificate

key_bit_size.description: The number of bits to allow for key generation

management_type.description: The level of management that Trust Protection Platform applies to the certificate

organizational_unit.description: Organizational unit attribute of the certificate

pkcs10.description: The PKCS10 formatted CSR for the certificate

reenable.description: Option to renew a previously disabled certificate

subject_alt_names.description: Skip parameter if the policy already specifies SAN Types. Array of subject alternative names (SANS) for the certificate. For each SAN, specify an array element with a Type and a corresponding Name. For example, SubjectAltNames:[ {Type:2, Name:www.example.com}, {Type:7, Name:122.122.122.122} ]. The Type parameter is an integer that represents the kind of SAN which can be 0:OtherName, 1: Email, 2:DNS, 6: URI, or 7:IPAddress. The Name value is the SAN Friendly name that corresponds to the Type parameter

actions.description: Returns a list of certificates in Venafi
actions.verbose: Returns certificate details and the total number of certificates that match specified search filters.

limit.description: Maximum number of certificates to return. Possible values are 1-100

offset.description: Number of results to skip (offset=5 begins results at page five)

key_algorithm.description: Algorithm for public key of Certificate

key_size_greater.description: Find certificates with a key size greater than the specified value

key_size_less.description: Find certificates with a key size less than the specified value

san_dns.description: Subject Alternative Name (SAN) Distinguished Name Server (DNS) attribute of Certificate

san_email.description: Subject Alternative Name (SAN) Email RFC822 attribute of Certificate

san_ip.description: Subject Alternative Name (SAN) IP Address attribute of Certificate

san_upn.description: Subject Alternative Name (SAN) User Principle Name (UPN) attribute of Certificate

san_uri.description: Subject Alternative Name (SAN) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) attribute of Certificate

signature_algorithm.description: Algorithm used to sign the Certificate

valid_from.description: YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmmmmmZ (Find certificates by the date of issue)

valid_to.description: YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmmmmmZ (Find certificates by expiration date)

valid_to_greater.description: YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmmmmmZ (Find certificates that expire after a certain date)

valid_to_less.description: YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmmmmmZ (Find certificates that expire before a certain date)

actions.description: Requests immediate renewal for an existing certificate in Venafi
actions.verbose: A renewable certificate cannot be currently processing, in error, or contain a 'Monitoring' Management Type.

certificate_dn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the certificate to renew

pkcs10.description: The PKCS10 formatted CSR to use for the renewal

reenable.description: Option to renew a previously disabled certificate

actions.description: Requests to revoke an existing certificate in Venafi
actions.verbose: The caller must have write permissions to the certificate object and either the CertificateDN or the Thumbprint parameter must be provided.

certificate_dn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the certificate to revoke

thumbprint.description: The thumbprint (hash) of the certificate to revoke

reason.description: The reason for revocation of the certificate. 0: None, 1: User key compromised, 2: CA key compromised, 3: User changed affiliation, 4: Certificate superseded, 5: Original use no longer valid

comments.description: Details about why the certificate is being revoked

disable.description: The setting to manage the certificate upon revocation. If true, the certificate is disabled and no new certificate may replace it. If false, the certificate is allowed to be replaced by a new certificate

example_values: Please refer to test generated certificates

output.example_value: Revocation is already completed. The certificate "\VED\Policy\Partner Dev\TLS\Certificates\Testing\testfriendlyname2" revocation was requested by another request or process.

example_values: Error from server. Status Code: 403 Data from server: {"Error":"Failed to revoke certificate; no permission."}

actions.description: Downloads specified certificate to the vault

certificate_dn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the certificate to download

format.description: The certificate format for the return data

friendly_name.description: The label or alias to use for Base64, JKS, or PKCS #12 formats. Required for the JKS format

include_chain.description: When the Format is Base64, PKCS #7, PKCS #12, or JKS, you can include the parent or root chain in the return data

include_private_key.description: When the Format is Base64, PKCS #12, or JKS, you can specify whether to return the private key

keystore_password.description: If the Format is JKS, you must set a keystore password. Use the same requirements as required for the Password parameter

password.description: If the IncludePrivateKey value is true, you must create a password. Password must be 12 characters and comprised of at least 3 of the following: uppercase alphabetic letters, lowercase alphabetic letters, numeric characters, special characters

root_first_order.description: The order of the certificate chain to trust

example_values: Successfully retrieved certificate and downloaded it to vault
Status: Successfully retrieved certificate and downloaded it to vault
